positive: I was between this and a macbook pro14", but I'm super satisfied and felt like it was a great deal to upgrade the RAM to 32 and the 1 tb HD w the free office pro acrobat std.

It is "only" 300 nits bright, some people complained about it being too dim for them, but I found it perfectly fine, I use it comfortably at 70-75% brightness (my desktop Dell monitor is only 250 nits and it it is still bright enough!)

negative: Gaming will kill the battery even faster, and it will lower its performance dropping the frame rate badly on battery.
It's a nice enough laptop, but averaging 3.5 hours of battery life from extremally light tasks with my mentioned battery saving attempts is bad, the linux sleep thing is bad too.

positive: It is "only" 300 nits bright, some people complained about it being too dim for them, but I found it perfectly fine, I use it comfortably at 70-75% brightness (my desktop Dell monitor is only 250 nits and it it is still bright enough!)
A few things to add in; Laptop keyboard so far is fantastic, they feel more like the good old membrane keyboard; and definitely feels a lot better to type on compare to laptops like Zephyrus.
So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
